text: Argodrepana marilo is a moth in the family Drepanidae. It was described by Wilkinson in 1970. It is found in New Guinea. The wingspan is 16.8-18.5 mm. The forewing costa is dark buff and there are grey subbasal antemedial, postmedial and double subterminal fasciae, as well as a faint ring in the cell between the antemedial and postmedial fasciae. The hindwings are as the forewings, but lack the subbasal fascia., 1977: A taxonomic study of a new genus of Drepanidae (Lepidoptera) from New Guinea. Proceedings of the Royal Entomological Society of London Series B 36 (1/2): 17-29. ==References== Category:Moths described in 1970 Category:Drepaninae Category:Moths of New Guinea
title: Argodrepana marilo
